hero.heading: Visualizing the Energy Transition
hero.subheading:
...with web applications and maps for desktops and smartphones:
Web App Maps – WAMs.
hero.alt: Map of a German region with colored areas

energysystem.heading: The energy system is complex
energysystem.text: The Energy Transition has many complicated aspects, all of which are interrelated. They are often difficult to communicate to target groups. With web apps, you can reach your target audience. We build them for you.
energysystem.alt: The energy system is presented more easily with a web app

maps.heading: Maps give you complex data at a glance
maps.text: WAMs help to keep track of large amounts of data. For example, with interactive graphics, maps, or quizzes.
maps.alt: Map of a German region with colored areas

targetgroup.heading: The web applications involve your target group
targetgroup.text: WAMs help directly engage stakeholders on-site or from home. Reactive visualizations are understandable for anyone.
targetgroup.alt: Illustration of mobile users and three different devices

egon.heading: eGo^n
egon.text: Visualization of scenario data from the eGo^n project
egon.aria: Open the eGo^n web app in a new window

enershelf.heading: Enershelf
enershelf.text: Help locate the market potential for photovoltaic-based mini-grids in the health sector of Ghana with the aim of overcoming energy scarcity and reducing frequent blackouts
enershelf.aria: Open the Enershelf web app in a new window
enershelf.alt: Visualization of Ghana on a map

cpnigeria.heading: CP Nigeria
cpnigeria.text: Toolbox to empower non-electrified communities in Nigeria to create their own mini-grid implementation plans through a bottom-up approach
cpnigeria.aria: Open the CP Nigeria web app in a new window

peoplesun.heading: People Sun
peoplesun.text: Open source tool to plan off-grid systems in Nigeria. It performs a spatial optimization of the distribution grid as well as designs the energy converters and storages. Developped within the PeopleSuN project
peoplesun.aria: Open the People Sun web app in a new window
peoplesun.alt: Illustration with different icons representing grid planning

openplan.heading: Open Plan
openplan.text: A cross-sector, open-source tool for the optimized planning of energy cells
openplan.aria: Open the Open Plan web app in a new window
openplan.alt: Illustration of a hexagon showing what an energy cell is

rgi.heading: Renewables Grid Initiative
rgi.text: Comparative analysis of spatial requirements for different decarbonisation scenarios
rgi.aria: Open the Renewables Grid Initiative web app in a new window

wwf.heading: WWF Energiewende-Dashboard
wwf.text: Visualization of the climate crisis and energy transition in Germany
wwf.aria: Open the WWF Energy Dashboard in a new window
wwf.alt: 2 examples of charts from the Energiewende-Dashboards on mobile devices

agora.heading: Photovoltaics and Wind Area Calculator
agora.text: The web tool commissioned by the German think tank Agora Energiewende shows which areas in Germany can be used as wind potential areas or for the installation of photovoltaic systems.
agora.aria: Open the Photovoltaics and Wind Area Calculator in a new window
agora.alt: Image of the Photovoltaics and Wind Area Calculator

digiplan.heading: DigiPlan Anhalt
digiplan.text:
DigiPlan Anhalt - the further development of the StEmp tool Anhalt-Bitterfeld-Wittenberg.
Map tool for regional transformation in the context of the energy system and land use.
digiplan.aria: Open the DigiPlan Anhalt web app in a new window

abw.heading: StEmp-Tool Anhalt-Bitterfeld-Wittenberg
abw.text: Interactive stakeholder empowerment tool for citizen participation. It simulates future energy systems of the region with consumption and generation.
abw.aria: Open stakeholder empowerment tool in a new window

heat.heading: StEmp Tool Heat – Mecklenburg
heat.text: Stakeholder empowerment tool for citizen participation. It  creates scenarios for cost-effective and environmentally friendly heat supply in people’s own neighborhood.
heat.aria: Open stakeholder empowerment tool in a new window
heat.alt: Image of the StEmp Tool Heat – Mecklenburg

contact.heading: We implement your project
contact.text: The WAMs are partly developed in research projects, and partly produced directly on behalf of energy transition actors.
contact.alt: Mobile device with UI and energy components

methods.heading: Scientific methods are comprehensible
methods.text: WAMs are based on real models and data from research. They help to make scientific processes transparent and comprehensible. They are built by energy transition experts, software developers, and open-science enthusiasts with a lot of know-how.
methods.alt: Illustration of different charts and sliders on desktop and mobile

data.heading: Scientists free data
data.text: As scientists of the Reiner Lemoine Institute, we want to free the data from their tables. Our team of energy transition professionals, software developers, and open-source enthusiasts is convinced that the best way for people to understand the energy transition is for them to play with consumption and generation figures.
data.alt: Various charts of energy performance on a desktop screen
